modules.description: Performs in-place translation and rotation of 3D vectors using custom infix operators. Operates on transformation states and 3D vectors, modifying the state directly. Used to apply sequential geometric transformations in a concise, readable manner.

Represents and manipulates OpenSCAD objects through a recursive type, enabling the construction of 3D models via transformations and operations. It supports in-place translation and rotation of 3D vectors using custom operators, allowing for clear, sequential geometric modifications. The module provides direct access to transformation states, enabling precise control over object positioning and orientation. Examples include rotating a cube 90 degrees around the X-axis or translating a cylinder along the Y-axis before union operations.

Converts text alignment and direction parameters to their string representations for OpenSCAD. Works with types representing horizontal and vertical alignment, and text direction. Used to generate precise configuration strings for text rendering in 3D models.
Converts color values to their string representation in OpenSCAD format. Works with a custom type representing RGB or named colors. Used to generate valid color syntax for 3D model rendering.

Provides operations to construct, manipulate, and transform 4x4 matrices, including matrix multiplication, addition, subtraction, transposition, and element-wise mapping. Works with 2D arrays of floats representing affine transformation matrices. Used to generate and modify transformation matrices for 3D modeling in OpenSCAD via Scad.multmatrix.

Constructs and manipulates rotation matrices from row or column lists, computes alignment rotations between vectors, and converts matrices to Euler angles. Operates on 3x3 matrices of floats, supporting arithmetic operations, element access, and transformations. Used to rotate 3D vectors and objects in geometric computations.

Provides operations such as arithmetic, transformation, and rotation, including spherical linear interpolation (slerp) and vector alignment, along with conversions between quaternions (t) and 3D vectors (Vec3.t). These enable precise control over rotational transformations, interpolation, and matrix-based applications in 3D graphics or spatial computations.

Provides element-wise arithmetic, normalization, dot/cross products, and rotation operations (including quaternions and axis-specific rotations) for 3D vectors represented as tuples of three floats. Supports transformations like translation, scaling, and projection, enabling spatial manipulations akin to Scad's 3D modeling capabilities. Includes coordinate extraction and unit conversion for precise geometric computations.

Generates 2D and 3D geometric models using SCAD primitives like circle, cube, and union, with operations that enforce dimensional consistency. Applies transformations such as rotate, translate, and linear_extrude, ensuring 2D shapes are only extruded and 3D shapes are not mixed in boolean operations. Compiles shapes into OpenSCAD code with automatic unit conversion from radians to degrees.

Encapsulates 3D modeling capabilities through recursive object representations, matrix operations, and vector transformations, enabling precise geometric manipulation. It handles color and text formatting, supports matrix arithmetic and rotation conversions, and provides vector operations for spatial computations. Users can rotate objects, translate shapes, generate color strings, and construct transformation matrices for complex 3D models. Examples include aligning text, applying quaternions for smooth rotations, and generating Euler angles for matrix-based transformations.
